text: As a shadow of vengeance rides the Sword of Solkan through the dark streets of Marienburg, some say his horse Phantom is the vengeful image of Solkan himself.
The finest steed freshly imported to the City-State of Marienburg.

Old Van de Kuypers does not lead from the front, but instead from the backrooms of the many estates in Marienburg. He leaves the conquering to Emperors, Tsars, Nobles and High-Kings. And what do those all have in common? They all owe money to Jaan van de Kuypers.
Guzunda Wallrattler once guided a group of Lizardmen through the Swamps of the Wasteland. Their leader, a Slann named Itzibitzi, set out to settle these swamps.
''No one does it better than me! Smuggling, of course. I was talking about smuggling''.
Very few men combine aptitude for business with a talent for swordplay, Pieter is one of them.
Money, power, and influenceâ€”these are my Gods. And Haeyndrik represents all that is money, power, and influence.

Van de Kuypers has interest in all sorts of rarities known to the Old and New World a like. Although no fighter by any means, his expensive exotic and imported equipment would suit that of a revered hero.

The Stadsraad is the ''democratic'' house of Marienburg. The Stadsraad is the building occupied by the two houses of the Wasteland's parliament. Al though democratic at first glance, it's noticeable Jaan has never lost a vote.
During his younger years Jaan has seen his fair share of seas. He was one of the first to explore a trade route with the far new world of Lustria, besting storms and reefs along the way.

Marienburg is located in the Wastelands, or ''Low-Lands''. These lands are below sea level. The Vloedmuur, or ''floodwall'', is one of the strongest defense mechanics employed by these Lowlanders. They simple breach a few dams and literally flood their lands. Forcing hostile forces on the retreat, or at the very least a slower advance.

Marienburg's navy is listest among the most powerful fleets of the world. A common military strategy employed by Marienburg is deploying relatively close to the shoreline. They use their powerful frigates to bombard enemy land forces from the sea.

The flagship of the Marienburger Navy, the mighty Zegepraal. It's mere sight causes both pirate and privateer to tremble. For Jaan it's just one of the few recently purchased assets for House Van de Kuypers.

Suiddock is one of the poorer districts of Marienburg and houses cutthroats, gamblers and dockworkers a like. Pieter was raised among fights and squabble, learning to hold his own with cutlass and dices.

Not just capable with the sword, Pieter has a taste for wealth, value and business. His posture commands respect amongst the common folk, and they respect his ability to evenly share the loot after battle. Some say this is a mistake, however..
Strompoort is a mighty tower that looks over the River Reik and the maritime gateway of Marienburg. Stacked with powder and metal chains to stop any hostile fleet in it's track.

On the seaward end of Tempelwijk by the entrance to Manaanshaven, Baron Henryk's College of Navigation and Sea Magicks is one of the Old World's premier centres of learning the crafts of seamanship. Pieter learned however, a hook has more functionalities than learned at Baron Henryk's.

Whenever House Van de Kuypers ship precious cargo, ''Big Piet'' is embedded on board of the various ships to prevent daring thieves, raiders and pirates to interfere with Guild business. Pieter de Groot is known to have never lost any cargo.

Pieter de Groot, commonly named ''Big Piet'', is well over six feet tall and powerfully built. His sandy hair and beard are close-cropped, and his blue eyes look somehow too small for his square face, which is rounded off by a razor-sharp jawline
The One they call Big Piet

Big Piet is the man who upheld the honour of the guild (and the whole Suiddock) in a trial-by-combat against the champion of a Tilean merchant house, as he has bested many champions in these trials before.
Gold makes the world go round. Jaan knows how to use wealth to influence diplomacy and geo-politics. He has many friends, yet even more enemies.

A specialty from the rich lands of Averland, the Mad Count Leitdorf offers Jaan a monopoly position when it comes to importing Averlander Corn. The count might be unpredicatable, his corn is worth it's weight in literal gold.

The finest wines hail from the Southern Lands of Tilea. Although Jaan often calls Miragliano the poor man's Marienburg, it is undisputably important to establish a position within it's complex market.

Ostlander pork belly is not only Jaan's favorite, it's also distinguishly exported by Osterlander Elector Count Von Raukov. Not just a valuable trade opportunity, Osterland would also account for a powerful military ally in Marienburg's expansionistic views.

Exotic cloths in lavish colours hailing from the distant lands of Estalia, perfectly suitable for Marienburger upper class citizens. Opening up trade with these rich lands opens up new venues of business opportunities.

Ever since the Great Orthodoxy took rule over the former trade hub that is Erengrad there is less room for the open-market. Many traders from these cold lands could be persuaded to settle in Marienburg, making this shift of power beneficial.

Trading with Norscan tribes is considered controversial and non-ethical by most, as one can never ask too many questions as to how these products are aquired. For Jaan they represent nothing but opportunities.
In all four corners, the business of Marienburg is.. Business.
The seas are governed by none. Mare Liberum is the declaration of the free seas, which is nothing more than a excuse to act without the boundaries known as laws and ethics.

The van de Kuypers are by far the richest and most powerful of the Ten Great Families of Marienburg. Clawing their way to power before Marienburg's independence through sharp, brutal business dealings. They are the true leaders of the Directorate: through their web of clients and contacts, they commands a block of eight votes.

A new technology in ship building, invented by the ship builders of Marienburg, is to create deeper hulls without the loss of manoeuvrability or speed. This allows the Merchant fleet of Marienburg to carry more cargo.

There is no more complex tax-system in the Old World than that employed by the Marienburger Directorate. It is so complex even, that there are only a handful of people that understand its working. Van de Kuypers is one of them.
''What has Marienburg to gain with a war with Reikland? Nothing. What has Marienburg to gain with a weakened Reikland? Everything.''

There is no trade without tradeable produce. In order to build a thriving and buzzling empire of trade, one needs to master the art of production. Artisans out of Marienburg have expertly learned how to standardize and perfectionize their craft.
People pray to Haeyndrik to bless their transactions, binding all parties to their agreements, even if that agreements forces them to lower arms.

At the end of a narrow alley off the street that runs behind the warehouses is a large but unobtrusive hostelry called the Pelican's Perch. There you shall find Simon Goudenkruin, praying on the greedy and ambitious. Taking large sums to offer his financial ''advices''.
Simon requires no aid to judge the worth of a commodity, it comes as natural as breathing to him.
''You can mock me with fakery, Peasant? I can smell carat in Gold bars and Jewelry from miles!''
''No no no.. You're doing it all wrong. It's all about the right diversion between wealth and property tax. Here, let me help''.
''No no no.. You're doing it all wrong. It's all about the right diversion between wealth and property tax. Here, let me help''.
Goudenkruin always strolls with the most exotic and fine wares available. Lords and heroes looking to keep up with the latest Cathayan trends tend to take note when Simon uses his contacts.
Simon pleads with his God to make sure that there will be a local merchant willing to deal with him. The prospect of profit envigorates his devotees.
Every city that houses a temple of Haeyndrik prospers. Or every Temple of Haeyndriks prospers.. One or the other.
Finding a good deal is not just talent, it's much like a sixth sense.

The most susceptible for Haeyndrik's appeal are those ambitious of power, money and influence. They would offer their gold to the power of wealth for the chance alone of seeing it doubled. One of his loyal devotees is Pieter de Groot, who aspires to become the richest known to man one day.

Prayers cause Goudenkruin's competitors and allies to speak well of him. All characters within range talk well of their past dealings with him, no matter how bad they may have been. It allows him to speak with the tongue of Haenydrik himself, drowning enemies in gold and coin with the mere words he speaks.

The Van Klumpf's buccanneers are known as the Marienburg murderers, for their ruthless tactics and murderous prowess. They are feared amongst enemy and allies a like. Their behaviour unpredicatble, their skill undisputed.
These men are attracted by the prospect of riches and wealth and would fight under any banner. Exactly the type of men to fight for Marienburg, all they need is a firm hand.

The Golden Pinions flock to wealth like flies flock around a corpse. The promise is wealth is their obession. This makes them a perfectly suitable core for a Van der Kuyper mercenary army. Their golden armor would suggest a capable force in combat, however most of it is stolen and their member comprised of former bandits and militia leaders.

There are two theories as to why these men are present on the battlefield. One is that van de Kuypers has soo much wealth, it is too much to store. The other and more plausible however, is that Jaan has grown so paranoid he never leaves his wealth out of his sight.

''The Golden Rule of business: Never let a good opportunity go to waste. With a weakened Reikland, we could enforce our taxes along the River Reik and perhaps, maybe, throughout the entire Empire..''.
Goudenkruin would often mutter prayers to the Merchant God and every transaction seems to go your way. This luck translates to the battlefield, where blows simply brush off the Arch-Priest
The finest steed freshly imported to the City-State of Marienburg.

This horse was a gift from Kislevite Nobles with outstanding debts to the Van de Kuypers. It is rumoured the drabes that decorate this fine horse alone cost over a fortune. Intended or not, it's a sight to be hold that inspires friendly troops.
The finest steed freshly imported to the City-State of Marienburg.

Only the finest wares for men who serve the Van de Kuypers. They lavish on wine from the far corners of the Old World and Jaan will always combine his travels with accumulating more oddities, rarities and antiquities.

Jaan despises the thought of long expeditions or hard fought battles at his age. He knows where best to serve his purpose. Not in some far away land but instead right below the New Palace, in the heart of the rich Marienburg district known as Goudberg, in the lavish manor of House Van de Kuypers. It is there where Jaan is most effective, controlling his global web of relations. In his villa wuth Tilean fluted columns and Nulner statues of Winged Victory mingled with gargoyles and faux-battlements from the time of the War of Independence. It is there where lies the true heart of his power.
Of the Cult of Solkan is the Sword that battles Chaos, The Sword of Solkan is it's sharpest tip.
As Solkan's agent calls out the heretic, he inflicts the retribution of the Gods of Law on those who offend them. The eyesless gaze of Solkan fixed on the transgressor.
One of Solkan's symbols is the golden fist. Displaying both Solkan's wrathful and pure nature.

The Liber Flamma Purgatio is a vital relic among the Cult of Solkan's acolytes. It is said to hold secrets instrumental in the fight against chaos, and many of chaos cultist has attempted to snatch it from the cult's watchful gaze.
Anonymous yet extremely wealthy sponsors enable the Sword to perform his actions. His sponsors count themselves true Marienburger aristocrats. Rooting for his cause.

The Order of the Shattered Amulet is a minor order part of the cult of Solkan, they are devote to restoring the most profound artifact of Solkan's lore, his amulet. Their quest has lead them to the Wasteland for reasons unknown.
Not only extremely skilled with his greatsword, the Sword of Solkan fights with a certain uncanning determination, giving him the edge against many of foe.
None can outrun Solkan's judgement, as in time all shall fall under his merciless gaze. Fleeing is only postponing the inevatible.
The Sword of Solkan relies on intelligence provided by the Black Caps, as the night's watch secretly shares their assumptions when they suspect the worship of Chaos.
Acting from the shadows, the agents of Solkan are the eyes and ears of the cult. Secretly operating throughout the entire Empire in their crusade against evil.

Not one living soul knows the true identity of the Sword of Solkan, but many speculate he must be a member of one of the most influential families. Perhaps even the most influential one. As he permits himself access to places unaccessable to others.
This Merchant Lord has served, or better said - has connections that served, as artillery officers in the State Army. That has it's perks.
It is not uncommon that Norscan tribes cross over with the Empiric provincies situated North of the Empire. Like the Bjornling tribe, who openly trade and migrate with Marienburg.
The State Navy is protected by flocks of Huge Seagull like Griffon Riders, they are expensive yet loyal.
This Merchant Lord knows keeping Ogres in check is not as hard as people say: Keep them fed and pay them well.
This Merchant Lord has traded not just along the Gilded Route, but the Ivory Road all the same.
Not all horses appreciate long trips a board merchant vessels, but the ones that don't mind are usually the most hardened horses out there.
This Merchant Lord has had much experience trading within the City of Nuln, where the finest gunpowder is tradeable.
Mixed heritage with old Westerlandic Nobility, the aristocrats of Marienburg relish at the thought of times of old.
Manann decides if we make it to our destination or not, nothing else. Manann is the wind, the tide and the waves. Pray he is lenient.
Along the various trade stops made by the convoy's one finds the most despicable abominations, ripe for Solkan's vengeance.
The Elves of Elfsgemeente have a fair deal of influence on Marienburger trade, although without a seat at the directorate's table.
House Fooger is one of the oldest and most influentual Merchant Families of the Wasteland, their convoys often protected by Dwarf brethren.
When business is slow in Erengrad, many traders migrate to Marienburg in search of better opportunities
Goldilock is the personal companion of the Arch-Priest of Haeyndrik, it's rider is said to be forever lucky in his endeavors.

There is always room for a little more cargo, especially if carried by the famous Guild's Baggage-Train.\\n\\n[[col:red]]Warning: Your unit with the lowest value will be replaced with Merchant Baggage train if this army has no space for them.[[/col]]
Keeping the Convoy fit and happy is vital for success among the Gilded Route.
Pay? Upkeep? Focus on the journey, the adventure. Is that not pay enough?
If bandits take a unfortunate swing at the convoy, good equipment might be the difference between life and death.
This Lord has gone to Reikland to follow several courses on the Reiksacademy, as with all threats along the route the Lords are as much Merchant as they are General.
Having travelled the Gilded route for so long, the Merchant Lord's know where to take short cuts
Did you declare everything at the Secretariat of Trade Equity? But of course, no need to double check the hull.
The finest steed freshly imported to the City-State of Marienburg.
The god of money, wealth and power protects it's patrons with a shield of coins.
He who is blessed by the God of Law fears only his wrathful gaze
Those who give in to Tsien-Tsin's call unlock the secrets of their future.
Tsien-Tsin's mutations are slow, starting with subtle colourful feathers growing from it's worshippers arms and legs. It's the start of a much more grander conversion.
The Den Euwe family is specialized in the jewelry trade. Having more expertise on gem value than most Dwarven holds.
Egmond is a talented alchemist, learning mixing potions and ingredients from a very young age on the buzzling market of Marienburg's Potion Square.
No other house has more connections in Cathay as House Den Euwe, having longstanding relations with merchants from Hanyu to Beichai. The result is a steady stream of valueable Eastern Oddities.
Adventuring from a very young age Egmond has more fighting experience as his looks might suggest.
Nipponese Nobles often pay tribute to their mythical God Orange Simca by offering it the colourfully painted skulls of their own ancestors. The more frivolous, the more boons.
House Den Euwe has it's headquarters on the Handelaarsmarkt in Marienburg, their influence there is rivalled only by the Van de Kuypers.
Den Euwe's are famed alchemists, brewing diverse potions with all sorts of effects. Faith will have it this particular batch will change you forever.
Young, ambitious, gifted with magic and talented with words. Egmond is ready to sail the four corners and establish his family name, among other things he seeks to establish.
Give in to change as one is submerged by Tsien-Tsin's fire.
Once Tsien-Tsin's secrets are unlocked one is truly liberated.
Blistering balls of scarlet flame emanate from the spellcaster to engulf the foe in deadly balefire.
The finest steed freshly imported to the City-State of Marienburg.
Gifted by a rather mysterious trader, Kawaru is Egmond's personal guardian and longma.
For years the grisly murders that haunted the dockyards of Marienburg were ascribed to a figure nicknamed the Suiddock Beast. Mundvard's Pet terrorgheist.
De Teuling was one of the first merchants known to the Old World and a Saint for the Cult, these cavalry warriors bare her name - long may it live on.
The Cult of Haeyndrik has no official knightly order, yet nothing comes as close as the Defenders of the Capital. A group of convoy guardians dating back from the times of Saint De Teuling.
Learning the art of smuggling on the duicks of Suiddock, Crispijn has some tricks to share.
How I got in Port Reaver? Simple, just a few quick short cuts I used en route.
What's the point of smuggling if you can't hide some of the good stuff in a few secret compartments.
Crispijn holds his own in the gruesome barfights on the streets of Suiddock. Being one of the few nobles to openly partake in streetfights, hence people call him the Goudberg Gladiator.
House Van Haagen is far more wealthier as their legal trade share suggests. The reason is their huge part in Marienburg's smuggling ring.
House Van Haagen has their biggest influence in the Zijdemarkt district, rivalled only by the Van de Kuypers.
As a young Dwarf Guzunda started out working in the mines, hauling precious gems and other oddities with the various sturdy carts.
Guzunda has a odd warm relationship with the Lizardmen, guiding them across the Wasteland's marshes for nothing but a few pints of ale.
The ability to sniff out precious gems is like a sixth sense for the Dwarven race.
There's nothing like the sight of a few Zhufbar pounders hitting their mark.
Wallrattler is the ultimate guide, unmoved by the dangers of the Wasteland he can guide people to the most forgotten places of the Low-Lands.
As all Dwarfs in Marienburg, Guzunda is on Clan Fooger's pay roll. A clan with aspirations for greatness, some day.
Mirror, mirror on the wall - who is the farest of them all?
In the Wasteland's criminal circuit nothing is more precious than information. Alicia has just the rights tools to extract information, from anything - or anyone.
Alicia often disguises herself and infiltrates the Goudberg Estates, it has learned her the decorum needed to blend in with Marienburg's aristocracy.
Monkshood is as pretty on the outside as it is poisonous on the inside. A sniff of it's pollen might render any man immobilized - or worse.
Alicia has served the Lord of Shadows for centuries, willing to give her life for him - even in death.
Nimble, ferocious and as charming as she is deadly, Alicia von Unterwald is the Consort of Shadows, Mundvard's right hand.
For centuries Mundvard has ruled the underworld of the Wasteland. Calculating, plotting and consolidating immense power and wealth.
Mundvard moves softly, fights slippery and treads elusive. Still the veins running through his wing are coursing with dark magic, making it harder than the thickest stone.

If the great merchant families that hold a seat in the directorate where not so busy squabbling amongst themselves, Mundvard might not have risen to such power. Profiting from Marienburg's corrupt nepotism at each step of the way.
Mundvard is ancient, even amongst vampires - still devotely following the teachigns of W'soran the Wicked, the Father of Vampires. Awaiting Nagash's return with everlasting patience.

If magic, bloodlust and evasiveness fails - there is always the irresistible smell of gold. Humans flock around it like flies flock around a dead corpse. They turn on each other in a flash at the mere sight of silver, it's quite the sight.
He is Mundvard, Lord of Shadows, ruler of the underground and scourge of the Wasteland.
''What makes the Thievies guild a disciplined organization instead of thieving rabble? Simple, Lisette Leerer''.
In Suiddock she's known as the Guild's Razor, a tool she frequently uses on those with the guts to make a move on her.
Trafficking goods untaxed in and out of Suiddock is vital in the Guild's success.
She sells potions and goods as a front one of the buzzling markets of Marienburg, skimming batches of poison as a side hustle.
The Leather business is much more profitable as one would imagine. It's easy to get your hands on, as you can harvest it from a lot more than just cattle.
Finding the weakspots of equipment is just like cracking a safe, and Lisette has plenty of experience doing just that.
If the Staatholder's Fog Walkers would be nearly as effective as Lisette Leerer when it comes to remaining unseen, Marienburg would be in a much different place.
Daefvid originally hails from the mysterious Isle of Aeryn, where the finest Sailors among Elves are raised.
No waters uncharted, no river not crossed - Maicross can sail you anywhere on any map.
He is infamous in taverns from Port Reaver to Beichai, Captain Daefvid is one of those adventurers bards sing their tales about. Or so he expects.
None has the verbal and retorical skill to tell the story of the Savonarola as Maefcross, a story of riches lost on a unfindable island, yet ripe for the taking for those who know where to look.
Asurian cuisance is otherwordly, and a very effective way to keep morale high. It has made Daefvid a welcome sight to any crew he sailed with.
A board the Black Dove Captain Maicross would often tighten the knots himself, trusting his abilities to shore up even a crashed Landship with a few simple knots.
Under the cover of his flamboyance, this dashing Captain hides a more serious layer. As he too often seen entering the Lothern Embassy in the Elfsgemeente.

Jaan despises the thought of long expeditions or hard fought battles at his age. He knows where best to serve his purpose. Not in some far away land but instead right below the New Palace, in the heart of the rich Marienburg district known as Goudberg, in the lavish manor of House Van de Kuypers. It is there where Jaan is most effective, controlling his global web of relations. In his villa wuth Tilean fluted columns and Nulner statues of Winged Victory mingled with gargoyles and faux-battlements from the time of the War of Independence. It is there where lies the true heart of his power.\\n\\n[[col:red]][[i]]Note: All the bonusses unlocked in this skill line only apply when Jaan is garrisoned in Marienburg.[[/i]][[/col]]
How independent are the Merchants of Marienburg truly if not one of them can strike a bargain without Van de Kuyper's blessing?

From his Goudberg Estate, Jaan maintains close relations with Countess Von Liebwitz. Not just because of her aptitude for trade, no - mostly because of the prodcut her State specializes in: Armaments.
Paranoid as he is, Jaan insists the Strompoort to be occupied by double shifts when he is present in the City.
Jaan's grandeur vision of Marienburg stands and falls by the willingness of the masonry to construct his projects. Some bribing won't harm anyone, and benefit the province as a whole.

Although not militaristic oriented, the Van de Kuypers value the State Army. As he knows it is the only thing that stands between indepedence and annexation. Jaan invests personally to ensure the Marienburger army is fitted to Empiric standards.
The Wastelanders specialize in the construction of bridges and dams, being forced to - as the ''Low-Lands'' are situated well below sea level. It allows them to traverse the marshes with ease.
Marienburg houses one of the greatest Libraries of the Old World, it's collection ever expanding. One only need one guess to find out who the main benefactor is.
A long the Gilded Route sail the extrovert Merchant Lords of Marienburg. Most of which do so for the Van de Kuyper's family, where those who bear Jaan's sigil are protected from most taxes.
The Merchant Guild's autonomy is a farce. Every tenth shilling is reserved for Van de Kuypers. As they control regulations, trade laws and edicts. Leeching from all profits made by others.

If you keep them dumb, I'll keep them poor''. - Jaan van de Kuypers to the Generals and admirals of the Marienburg State Army. 	false
